title: font for back to the future - twin pines mall
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021031935im_/http:/typophile.com/files/twin_6434.jpg)

the S is throwing me off. i thought it was franklin gothic or helvetica but the w seems too condensed although it maybe the perspective
author: drarwin

comments.content:
Those are not great diagnostic letters for an ID. Seems like many sans fonts might work, but I scanned MyFonts looking for 'humanist' sans fonts with a somewhat closed S. Depending on how obsessive you are about exactness, you might be able to use [Travis](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021031935/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/protimient/travis/). The S is a bit more closed than your sample, but the W is relatively narrow and the M is straight-sided. Those three letters are about all you've shown that can be used as a filter.

- Mike Yanega
